gml:Point.gml:name: Tie Point in upper left corner

abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is a widely used, dimensionless index that is indicative for vegetation density and is defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) where NIR corresponds to the reflectance in the near infrared bands, and Red to the reflectance in the red bands.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global component of the Copernicus Land service. It can be also useful for all applications related to environment monitoring.

credit.gco:CharacterString: NDVI products were generated by the Global Land Service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The product is based on Sentinel-3 333m data (copyright EU Copernicus and distribution by ESA).

positionName.gco:CharacterString: Copernicus Global Land Service Help Desk

European Commission Directorate-General Joint Research Centre

fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Subsampled quicklook image of NDVI layer

otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:remarks: NDVI uncertainty propagated from reflectance uncertainty

positionName.gco:CharacterString: Copernicus Global Land Service Help Desk

orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe and Africa. When ordering products from the online archive or subscribing to receive future products, users are informed via e-mail whenever the requested products are ready to be downloaded on the FTP server.

description.gco:CharacterString: Information on how to search, download, order products or subscribe to future products
Register to receive products via EUMETCast telecom satellite

title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines
INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

statement.gco:CharacterString: The NDVI is calculated from global, 10-daily, BRDF normalized, top-of-canopy reflectances derived from seven bands of Sentinel-3/OLCI optical observations. Prior to NDVI calculation, the four narrow RED TOC-r bands and the three narrow NIR TOC-r bands are converted to a broad RED and NIR reflectance by averaging. The NDVI is calculated using the Red and Nir relfectance values while filtering sea pixels, out-of-range and missing input reflectances. When less-than-optimal input reflectances are used, this is indicated as a quality flag.
